snippet: Nevada recently authorized the commercial trapping of crayfish at Lake Tahoe, a move aimed at improving the famed, though vulnerable, water clarity of an American natural treasure.
abstract: Nevada has authorized the commercial trapping of crayfish in Lake Tahoe, after local scientists persuaded state authorities that it would increase water clarity in the lake and provide a much-needed boost to local business; crayfish population has swelled to 280 million since their introduction more than a century ago.
lead_paragraph: Nevada recently authorized the commercial trapping of crayfish at Lake Tahoe, a move aimed at improving the famed, though vulnerable, water clarity of an American natural treasure.

headline.seo: At Lake Tahoe, Commercial Fishing Is Approved
headline.main: Crayfish to Eat, and to Clean the Water
headline.print_headline: Crayfish to Eat, and to Clean the Water
